channel.title: This is just a question
channel.description: I'd like to learn what a method was exactly?

item.title: This is just a question
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

Reputation means nothing.

http://download.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/java/javaOO/methods.html

Read full topic

item.title: This is just a question
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“Wintercanon, post:9, topic:378576”][quote author=Clawz fury link=topic=474445.msg3469243#msg3469243 date=1295163603]
This is an example of a method

public void method() { if(method == false) { method = true; } getMethod = false; }

Then to call that method you would use:

method();

A method can also have int’s and booleans, Strings etc. for example:

public void method(String size, int depth) { talk("Uhm, you are " +size+ " tall, and "+depth+" feet long"); }

Then to call that method you would use:

method("very", 10);

Then if you used that in-game you would get:

Uhm, you are " +size+ " very tall, and “+depth+” 10 feet long

Sorry I explained it poorly.
[/quote]Those ints and booleans are called method arguments. Also don’t forget to indent.[/quote]

Yes yes yes, xD, I just whipped up a code real fast.

Good to know someone without 100+ rep actually knows something.

Read full topic

Then to call that method you would use:

item.title: This is just a question
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

This is an example of a method

public void method() { if(method == false) { method = true; } getMethod = false; }

Then to call that method you would use:

method();

A method can also have int’s and booleans, Strings etc. for example:

public void method(String size, int depth) { talk("Uhm, you are " +size+ " tall, and "+depth+" feet long"); }

Then to call that method you would use:

method("very", 10);

Then if you used that in-game you would get:

Uhm, you are " +size+ " very tall, and “+depth+” 10 feet long

Sorry I explained it poorly.

Read full topic
